title: Gospel Rescue Mission
text:
Our Mission Statement

Hope. Shelter. Transformation

title: Gospel Rescue Mission
text:
Our Vision Statement

We welcome the hungry and hurting; we address their immediate needs; we build authentic relationships; and we share the Gospel so that total transformation happens. The grace of Christ is an amazing gift to be shared with everyone. We dedicate our lives to the homeless and the poor, and we know that God provides complete life change to those who place their trust in Him. Our holistic approach addresses the needs of the whole person—mind, body, and spirit. We work in collaboration with those who are passionate about bringing permanent solutions to the crisis of homelessness.

title: Casa de los Niños
text:
About Casa de los Niños

For over 49 years, Casa de los Niños has served the Tucson community to prevent child abuse and neglect and to support and empower families. We deliver a continuum of evidence-based services to effectively address the needs of children and families within our community.

title: CONQUER THE HILL
text: Welcome to Conquer the Hill, a beacon of hope and a testament to the resilience of the human spirit. Our initiative started from a simple yet profound vision crafted by Rosselyn Fadul and Jade Blair. They dreamed of fostering a safer space for individuals, especially women, to forge connections, access community resources, and cultivate support systems to thrive against life’s challenges.

title: CONQUER THE HILL
text:
Our Inception
The inaugural Conquer the Hill event encapsulated our mission of solidarity and strength. It was a celebration of powerful individuals ascending together, both metaphorically and physically, supporting one another through life’s tough terrains. It was about recognizing our pains but refusing to let them define our future. This event became more than just a climb; it evolved into a transformative experience that generated over $1,200 in donations for local organizations, sparked life-saving friendships, and instilled newfound confidence in those who felt lost or alone.

title: CONQUER THE HILL
text:
Why Tumamoc Hill?
Tumamoc Hill was chosen not just for its challenging path but for its symbolic significance. It represents the road less traveled — a journey of community and mutual uplift. As we climb, we shed our burdens and rise above the past. Reaching the summit is more than a physical feat; it’s a spiritual reclamation, where we reclaim control of our lives, thoughts, and actions.

title: CONQUER THE HILL
text:
Expanding Horizons
This year, Conquer the Hill embraces a significant evolution — extending our embrace to include men in this journey of healing and empowerment. Mental health and the impact of abuse are often silent battles for many men, and we are dedicated to breaking this silence. Our collaboration with the compassionate community of Tucson reflects our commitment to opening dialogues, providing support, and offering guidance to all who seek it.

title: CONQUER THE HILL
section: A Future of Hope and Healing
text:
A Future of Hope and Healing
As we prepare for this year’s event, we invite you to join us. It’s more than an event; it’s a movement towards a life marked by worth, confidence, hope, and success. Whether you’ve faced long-standing battles or recent struggles, know that you are not alone. At Conquer the Hill, we don’t just offer resources — we are the resource. Let’s climb together, helping each other to reach not just the top of the hill but the pinnacle of our potential.
Join us on this journey. Together, we can and we will conquer the hill.

title: Tucson Veterans Serving Veterans
text:
About Tucson Veterans Serving Veterans
Tucson Veterans Serving Veterans will continue to work closely with our state and city officials, Department of Veteran Administration, and local organizations regarding COVID-19 to ensure that every veteran remains in their home, has access to financial assistance and resources, and essential needs during this time.

title: La Frontera Arizona
text:
About La Frontera Arizona

Founded in 1968, La Frontera Center was one of the original 947 community mental health centers established during the initial stages of the community mental health movement. Since its inception, the Center has been committed to the provision of services to the economically disadvantaged and culturally diverse.


The Center originally operated with a staff of five people working out of a store front, serving an area of Tucson with the highest rate of unemployment, lowest level of educational attainment, highest arrest rate, highest proportion of welfare recipients, and the largest percentage of families living in crowded conditions.


Today, La Frontera Center is the largest nonprofit community behavioral health care organization in southern Arizona, and is in the top 10% nationally, with approximately 500 employees working out of many different locations throughout metropolitan Tucson and the surrounding county.


With treatment programs for children, adolescents, and adults, for substance abuse, co-occurring disorders, and serious mental illness, La Frontera provides an accessible, coordinated, and comprehensive network of mental health and substance abuse services for the residents of Pima County. La Frontera also has a long track record of conducting comprehensive program evaluation and obtaining federal demonstration and research grants (CSAP, CSAT, NIDA). Several of La Frontera’s programs have won national awards, and La Frontera has one of the leading dual diagnosis programs in the nation.

title: A Hand Up Not A Handout
text:
Our Mission Statement

AHUNHO is a family dedicated to helping with major mental health issues affecting the youth in African Americans and diverse communities. Out goal is to help individuals learn about their culture and provide resources that could help with breaking generational traumas. This would include therapy, coping mechanisms, and to encourage a healthy lifestyle.

title: A Hand Up Not A Handout
text:
Our Vision Statement

To be a major contributing force in stopping the self-destruction of the Black and Brown communities.


Help be the first steps in breaking generational curses.


To convince our youth that their own limit is the size of their ideas and the degree of dedication.


It starts with us.

title: I Am You 360
text:
About I Am You 360

I Am You 360 is an award-winning, forward-thinking, progressive, innovative, led by an African American woman is leading in diversity and inclusion Desiree Cook’s lived experience inspired her to revolutionize a movement called “I Am Somebody”.

title: Exciting News: Conquer the Hill 2024 is Here!
section: How the Event Will Run This Year:
text:
How the Event Will Run This Year:
After our walk up Tumamoc Hill, we will gather at a separate venue to be determined, where we’ll enjoy light food and beverages and listen to inspiring speakers share their stories of hope, resilience, and resources for moving forward. Stay tuned for the venue details!

 Register Now:
Although this is a FREE event, please sign up through Eventbrite (link below) so we can get an accurate headcount and make sure we’re prepared for everyone! Let’s make this year the best yet!

title: Teen Challenge Arizona
text:
About Teen Challenge Arizona
To provide youth, adults and families with an effective and comprehensive Christian Faith-based solution to life-controlling problems in order to become productive members of society. Teen Challenge of Arizona endeavors to help people become mentally sound, emotionally balanced, socially adjusted, physically well and spiritually alive.

title: Charities
text:
It’s that time of year again! Last year, we put together the very first Conquer the Hill event. This event was geared towards women who were survivors of domestic violence, sexual abuse, or in need of support.
THIS YEAR, WE ARE DOING A CO-ED EVENT! Both men and women deal with traumas, pains due to sexual abuse, PTSD, mental health, domestic violence, homelessness, and so much more. What most people don’t know is that Tucson is a HUB full of resources to help those in need of recovery services such as therapy, shelter, education, and financial assistance.
This is more than just a climb up a hill! We will be collecting donations to help fund organizations in Tucson that provide these resources all year long. We have put together an incredible team of people who will be helping me work on this to make it a valuable event for everyone. This is not just a one-day thing; we are expanding our resources and knowledge to ensure that everyone has access to anything they may need to continue their healing journey beyond November 5th.
We will be doing raffles throughout the month of October and holding special events to raise money for this cause!
If you are willing to donate some of your services, products, or make a contribution on behalf of your company it would be greatly appreciated!!
